content: fabulous freddie pattern by acanthus crochet fabulous freddie © 2024 acanthus crochet 1 fabulous freddie cthulhu crochet pattern by acanthus crochet amigurumi pattern introduction freddie is a stylish fun-loving frog who likes to look his best you get to customize your freddie by picking one of three hat options there is a crown for freddie the frog prince a top hat for freddie the gentleman and a pointy hat for freddie the sorcerer size freddie without a hat is 3 15 inch/8 cm high skill level the pattern requires familiarity with the basic amigurumi stiches and is thus suitable to advanced beginners or intermediate crocheters yarn the specific amount of yarn needed depends on which hat option is made for this pattern a fine cotton yarn was used specifically schachenmayr catania standard yarn weight 2 fine 1 75 oz/137 yds 50g/125m it is a very popular yarn for the making of especially amigurumi and has even been certified as suitable to produce toys din en 71-3 2019 yarn color a light green catania color 00392 yellow green need around 77 yds / 70 m yarn color b white catania color 00106 white need around 13 yds/ 12 m yarn color e purple catania color 00282 phlox need around 13 yds/ 12 m for hat option 1 yarn color c black catania color 00110 black need around 13 yds/ 12 m for hat option 2 and a small amount for option 1 yarn color d yellow catania color 00249 gold need around 13 yds/ 12 m for hat option 3 fabulous freddie © 2024 acanthus crochet 2 hook size us 2 2 5 mm other materials two safety eyes 0 5 inch / 12 mm or larger sewing needle scissors fiber fill and stitch markers stitches the pattern uses us terminology most stitches are single_crochet with single_crochet increase and decreases as needed where slightly more complicated stitches are needed in the pattern step by step instructions illustrated with photographs are provided in the pattern video tutorials in my youtube channel i provide several short how to tutorials on a range of amigurumi basics i also have tutorials specific to the fabulous freddie range of patterns i have tried to include a hyperlink to the relevant tutorial in the appropriate place within the instructions just click on the icon but if for some reason the links do not work in your pdf you can find these two playlists on my channel https //www youtube com/@acanthuscrochet/playlists stitch abbreviations
